title: Integrate Math Library and Implement Calculation Engine
description: Select, integrate, and wrap a third-party math library (e.g., math.js) to create a core calculation engine. This engine will parse string expressions, respect order of operations (PEMDAS), and handle basic arithmetic.
sprint_goal: Deliver a functional, non-persistent calculator MVP. Establish complete auth infrastructure. Build the initial CI/CD setup for docs and a11y checks.
acceptance_criteria: The engine correctly evaluates '5+3*2' to 11. The engine throws a specific, catchable error for '8/0'.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing with >95% coverage; Integrated into main application.
testing_requirements: Unit tests for all arithmetic operations.
deployment_notes: Core logic component, must be thoroughly tested.
business_value: Establishes the foundational calculation capability for the entire application.

title: Develop Core Calculator UI Components (Display & Keypad)
description: Create the main React components for the calculator display and the interactive keypad using Material-UI. Wire up button clicks to an internal state manager.
sprint_goal: Deliver a functional, non-persistent calculator MVP. Establish complete auth infrastructure. Build the initial CI/CD setup for docs and a11y checks.
acceptance_criteria: UI renders a grid of buttons for 0-9, +, -, ร, รท, =, C. Clicking a button appends its character to the expression state. The layout is responsive.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Component tests passing; UI is responsive and accessible.
testing_requirements: Component tests, Manual responsiveness testing.
deployment_notes: Core UI for the entire application.
business_value: Provides the primary user interface for all calculator interactions.

title: Integrate UI with Calculation Engine and State Management
description: Connect the Keypad and Display components to a Redux Toolkit slice. Pressing '=' should trigger the calculation engine with the current expression, update the result state, and handle any errors.
sprint_goal: Deliver a functional, non-persistent calculator MVP. Establish complete auth infrastructure. Build the initial CI/CD setup for docs and a11y checks.
acceptance_criteria: Pressing '=' with a valid expression updates the display with the correct result. Pressing 'C' clears the expression.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; E2E tests for basic arithmetic flows passing.
testing_requirements: E2E testing in Cypress.
deployment_notes: Connects foundational UI and logic.
business_value: Makes the core calculator functional and interactive.

title: Develop History Panel UI Component
description: Create a React component using Material-UI to display a list of calculation history items. The component should handle an empty state and become scrollable when content overflows.
sprint_goal: Deliver a functional, non-persistent calculator MVP. Establish complete auth infrastructure. Build the initial CI/CD setup for docs and a11y checks.
acceptance_criteria: Component correctly renders a list of expression/result pairs. Displays 'No history yet' message when empty. Panel is scrollable.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Component tests passing; UI is responsive.
testing_requirements: Component tests for rendering and scrolling.
deployment_notes: UI for core history feature.
business_value: Provides visual representation for user's calculation history.

title: Integrate History with State for Anonymous Users
description: Update the calculator's Redux slice to manage a session-based history array. After each successful calculation, the new history item is added to the top of this array.
sprint_goal: Deliver a functional, non-persistent calculator MVP. Establish complete auth infrastructure. Build the initial CI/CD setup for docs and a11y checks.
acceptance_criteria: After a calculation, the history array in the Redux store is updated. The History Panel UI re-renders. A hard refresh clears the history.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests for reducer passing; E2E test passing.
testing_requirements: Unit tests for Redux; E2E test for anonymous history flow.
deployment_notes: Enables session-based history for all users.
business_value: Improves usability for anonymous users by providing immediate history feedback.

title: Frontend: Implement Ohm's Law Calculator Component
description: Create a self-contained React component with four input fields. Implement the client-side logic to watch for changes, identify when two fields are valid, and calculate the other two based on Ohm's Law and the Power Law.
sprint_goal: Deliver a functional, non-persistent calculator MVP. Establish complete auth infrastructure. Build the initial CI/CD setup for docs and a11y checks.
acceptance_criteria: All 6 combinations of two inputs correctly calculate the other two values. UI provides guidance for insufficient input.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Component tests cover all 6 calculation paths; UI is accessible.
testing_requirements: Component tests for all calculation paths.
deployment_notes: First specialized electronics feature.
business_value: Provides a core, high-utility feature for the target electronics audience.

title: Infrastructure: Define Cognito User Pool via Terraform
description: Create the Terraform configuration for the AWS Cognito User Pool, specifying the strict password policy (REQ-1-071) and an app client configured for OAuth 2.0 with PKCE (REQ-1-039).
sprint_goal: Deliver a functional, non-persistent calculator MVP. Establish complete auth infrastructure. Build the initial CI/CD setup for docs and a11y checks.
acceptance_criteria: `terraform apply` successfully provisions the Cognito User Pool. Password policy and PKCE are correctly configured.
definition_of_done: Terraform code reviewed; Infrastructure successfully deployed to dev environment.
collaboration_required: Backend and Frontend teams for configuration details.
testing_requirements: Manual verification in AWS console; validation via downstream auth tasks.
deployment_notes: Critical infrastructure for all user-related features.
business_value: Establishes the secure foundation for user identity management.

title: Backend: Implement JWT Auth Guard and User Service
description: Create a NestJS Guard using Passport.js to validate Cognito-issued JWTs. Implement a UsersService to synchronize user records between Cognito and the local PostgreSQL database after registration.
sprint_goal: Deliver a functional, non-persistent calculator MVP. Establish complete auth infrastructure. Build the initial CI/CD setup for docs and a11y checks.
acceptance_criteria: A NestJS Guard rejects requests with invalid tokens. A successful Cognito registration creates a user in the local `users` table.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration tests for auth guard and user service passing; DB migration script created.
testing_requirements: API integration tests for protected and unprotected endpoints.
deployment_notes: Security-critical backend component.
business_value: Secures the backend API and enables user-specific data storage.

title: Frontend: Implement Registration Form UI and Validation
description: Create the React component for the user registration form using Material-UI. Implement comprehensive client-side validation for email format, password strength, password confirmation, and ToS checkbox.
sprint_goal: Deliver a functional, non-persistent calculator MVP. Establish complete auth infrastructure. Build the initial CI/CD setup for docs and a11y checks.
acceptance_criteria: Registration form renders correctly and is responsive. Client-side validation provides immediate feedback. 'Register' button is disabled until form is valid.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Component tests passing for validation logic.
testing_requirements: Component tests for form validation.
deployment_notes: Entry point for new users.
business_value: Provides the user interface for account creation.

title: Frontend: Implement Cognito Registration and Login Flow
description: Integrate the registration form with AWS Cognito. Upon successful registration, automatically trigger the OAuth PKCE login flow, exchange the code for tokens, and update the application's auth state.
sprint_goal: Deliver a functional, non-persistent calculator MVP. Establish complete auth infrastructure. Build the initial CI/CD setup for docs and a11y checks.
acceptance_criteria: Submitting a valid registration form creates a user in Cognito. After registration, the user is automatically logged in via PKCE. JWTs are received and stored securely.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; E2E tests for registration and auto-login are passing.
testing_requirements: Cypress E2E tests for the full registration and login flow.
deployment_notes: Complex and security-sensitive user flow.
business_value: Enables new users to create accounts and access personalized features.

title: Integrate Automated Accessibility Testing (Axe) into E2E Suite
description: Configure the Cypress E2E test suite to run `axe-core` checks on every page navigation and critical UI state change. Configure the CI pipeline to fail the build on new, critical accessibility violations.
sprint_goal: Deliver a functional, non-persistent calculator MVP. Establish complete auth infrastructure. Build the initial CI/CD setup for docs and a11y checks.
acceptance_criteria: Axe checks are integrated into Cypress. CI pipeline fails on new critical violations.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; CI pipeline successfully demonstrates blocking a PR with a new violation.
testing_requirements: Integration with E2E suite.
deployment_notes: Establishes a critical quality gate for the project.
business_value: Automates accessibility compliance checks, reducing risk of regressions and costly rework.

title: Initialize and Configure Docusaurus Project
description: Set up a new Docusaurus project within the monorepo. Create the initial documentation structure with placeholder Markdown files for the main sections.
sprint_goal: Deliver a functional, non-persistent calculator MVP. Establish complete auth infrastructure. Build the initial CI/CD setup for docs and a11y checks.
acceptance_criteria: The Docusaurus project is created and runs locally. The folder structure for documentation is in place.
definition_of_done: Project structure reviewed and merged into main branch.
testing_requirements: Local build verification.
deployment_notes: Foundation for the in-app help system.
business_value: Establishes the framework for all product documentation.

title: Integrate Docusaurus Build into CI/CD Pipeline
description: Update the GitHub Actions workflow to include a job that builds the Docusaurus static site. Configure the deployment step to upload the generated static assets.
sprint_goal: Deliver a functional, non-persistent calculator MVP. Establish complete auth infrastructure. Build the initial CI/CD setup for docs and a11y checks.
acceptance_criteria: The CI/CD pipeline successfully builds the Docusaurus site. The built assets are deployed and accessible at a specific path.
definition_of_done: CI job is passing; deployed assets are verified in staging.
testing_requirements: Verification of deployed assets.
deployment_notes: Automates the deployment of help content.
business_value: Ensures documentation is always up-to-date with the deployed application.

title: Backend: Develop API and DB Schema for History
description: Create the `calculation_history` table via a TypeORM migration script. Develop the NestJS module with protected GET and POST endpoints for fetching and adding history items for the authenticated user.
sprint_goal: Enable data persistence for history. Build the complete custom mode wizard UI framework and backend API. Integrate the help system modal.
acceptance_criteria: DB migration script creates table. `POST /history` saves a record. `GET /history` returns user-specific records. Endpoints reject unauthenticated requests.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; API integration tests passing.
testing_requirements: API integration tests covering CRUD and authorization.
deployment_notes: First persistent data feature for users.
business_value: Provides the backend foundation for persistent user calculation history.

title: Frontend: Integrate History Panel with Backend for Registered Users
description: Use RTK Query to create hooks for fetching history (`useGetHistoryQuery`) and adding history (`useAddHistoryMutation`). Upon login, trigger the query to fetch and populate history. After a calculation, call the mutation.
sprint_goal: Enable data persistence for history. Build the complete custom mode wizard UI framework and backend API. Integrate the help system modal.
acceptance_criteria: On login, history panel populates from API. New calculation triggers POST request. UI handles loading/error states.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; E2E tests for logged-in history flow passing.
testing_requirements: E2E tests for logged-in user history.
deployment_notes: Connects history UI to the persistence layer.
business_value: Enables persistent, cross-device history for registered users.

title: Backend: Implement CRUD API for Custom Modes
description: Create the NestJS module, TypeORM entity, DB migration, and protected CRUD endpoints for managing custom modes. The mode definition will be stored in a JSONB column.
sprint_goal: Enable data persistence for history. Build the complete custom mode wizard UI framework and backend API. Integrate the help system modal.
acceptance_criteria: DB migration created. User can CRUD their own modes. User is blocked from accessing others' modes. JSON definition is validated.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; API integration tests passing for all CRUD and auth scenarios.
testing_requirements: API integration tests.
deployment_notes: Backend foundation for the key differentiator feature.
business_value: Provides the persistence layer for user-created custom modes.

title: Frontend: Develop Multi-Step Wizard Framework
description: Build a reusable, stateful wizard component in React that manages navigation between steps and aggregates data. Implement the first step for defining the mode's name and description.
sprint_goal: Enable data persistence for history. Build the complete custom mode wizard UI framework and backend API. Integrate the help system modal.
acceptance_criteria: Wizard component displays different child components per step. Navigation functions correctly. First step UI with validation is implemented.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Component tests for wizard framework passing.
testing_requirements: Component tests.
deployment_notes: A reusable architectural component for the custom mode feature.
business_value: Creates the user-facing framework for building custom modes.

title: Frontend: Implement Wizard Steps for Variables and Formulas
description: Develop the subsequent steps of the wizard: a UI to dynamically manage lists of input/output variables (US-042) and a formula editor with real-time syntax validation (US-043, US-044).
sprint_goal: Enable data persistence for history. Build the complete custom mode wizard UI framework and backend API. Integrate the help system modal.
acceptance_criteria: User can add/edit/delete variables. Formula editor provides real-time validation. Wizard progression is blocked on invalid input.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; E2E test for complete wizard flow passing.
testing_requirements: E2E test for creating a full custom mode.
deployment_notes: Implements the core logic-definition UI for custom modes.
business_value: Allows users to define the structure and logic of their custom calculators.

title: Frontend: Implement Help System Modal and Integration
description: Create a persistent help icon in the main application layout. On click, it should open a large, accessible modal dialog. Implement the logic to load and display the Docusaurus-generated content within this modal.
sprint_goal: Enable data persistence for history. Build the complete custom mode wizard UI framework and backend API. Integrate the help system modal.
acceptance_criteria: Help icon is always visible. Clicking opens a modal. Modal loads and displays help content. Modal is responsive and accessible.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; E2E test passing.
testing_requirements: E2E test to verify modal opens and content loads.
deployment_notes: Integration between SPA and static documentation site.
business_value: Makes help content readily accessible to users within the application.

title: Content: Author Placeholder and Core Help Pages
description: Write the initial help content for the core features being developed in the first few sprints, including Basic Arithmetic, Ohm's Law, and the registration process.
sprint_goal: Enable data persistence for history. Build the complete custom mode wizard UI framework and backend API. Integrate the help system modal.
acceptance_criteria: A main index page is created. At least one help page is authored for each main feature category. Content is clear and user-friendly.
definition_of_done: Content reviewed and merged.
testing_requirements: Peer review of content.
deployment_notes: Populates the help system with initial content.
business_value: Provides users with essential information to use the application effectively.

title: Infrastructure & Backend: Implement Secure Sandbox Lambda
description: Develop and deploy the AWS Lambda function using `isolated-vm` to execute untrusted formulas. Configure IAM roles, resource limits, and the allow-list of functions as per REQ-1-018 and REQ-1-019.
sprint_goal: Deliver the secure sandbox for custom mode execution and the core framework for offline data synchronization.
acceptance_criteria: Lambda is deployed via Terraform. It executes valid formulas and rejects invalid ones. Security review is approved.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Security review approved.
testing_requirements: Unit tests for sandbox logic; Manual invocation testing.
deployment_notes: Most security-sensitive component of the application.
business_value: Provides the secure execution environment that makes custom modes possible.

title: Backend: Implement Formula Execution Orchestration API
description: Create the `POST /custom-modes/:id/execute` endpoint. This endpoint will authorize the user, fetch the mode definition, invoke the Lambda sandbox, and return the results or errors.
sprint_goal: Deliver the secure sandbox for custom mode execution and the core framework for offline data synchronization.
acceptance_criteria: Endpoint correctly orchestrates Lambda invocation. Handles success and error cases. Enforces ownership.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; API integration tests passing.
testing_requirements: API integration tests mocking the Lambda SDK.
deployment_notes: Connects the main application to the secure sandbox.
business_value: Exposes the custom calculation capability via a secure API.

title: Frontend: Implement Service Worker for Offline Capability
description: Configure and implement a service worker to cache the application shell and assets, enabling the application to load and function offline after the first visit.
sprint_goal: Deliver the secure sandbox for custom mode execution and the core framework for offline data synchronization.
acceptance_criteria: App reloads while offline. Core calculator functions are usable offline. Cache-busting is implemented for updates.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; E2E tests simulating offline conditions passing.
testing_requirements: E2E tests with network manipulation.
deployment_notes: Foundation for all offline functionality.
business_value: Enables the application to be used reliably in low/no-connectivity environments.

title: Frontend: Implement IndexedDB Queueing Service
description: Develop a TypeScript service to abstract interactions with IndexedDB. This service will be responsible for creating a versioned database and providing methods to manage queued API mutations.
sprint_goal: Deliver the secure sandbox for custom mode execution and the core framework for offline data synchronization.
acceptance_criteria: Service can create/open DB. Actions can be added to an 'outbox'. Queued actions can be retrieved and deleted.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Manual verification of DB in dev tools.
testing_requirements: Unit tests for the queueing service.
deployment_notes: Core component for storing offline changes.
business_value: Provides a durable queue for data modifications made while offline.

title: Backend: Implement Conflict Resolution Logic
description: Modify backend services for mutable data to handle 'last-write-wins' conflict resolution by comparing client-provided timestamps with the database `updated_at` timestamp.
sprint_goal: Deliver the secure sandbox for custom mode execution and the core framework for offline data synchronization.
acceptance_criteria: An update request with a stale timestamp is rejected with 409 Conflict. The 409 response includes the authoritative server data.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; API integration tests passing for the 409 scenario.
testing_requirements: API integration tests for conflict resolution.
deployment_notes: Critical for maintaining data consistency with offline sync.
business_value: Ensures data integrity when users modify data on multiple devices or while offline.

title: Frontend: Implement Sync Manager and UI Feedback
description: Create a Sync Manager to listen for network state changes, process the IndexedDB queue, and handle responses (including 409 conflicts). Implement UI indicators for sync status.
sprint_goal: Deliver the secure sandbox for custom mode execution and the core framework for offline data synchronization.
acceptance_criteria: When online, queued actions are sent. 409 conflicts update local state with server data. UI shows sync status.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; E2E tests simulating network loss and restoration passing.
testing_requirements: Complex E2E tests for offline synchronization.
deployment_notes: Integrates all parts of the offline sync feature.
business_value: Makes the offline capability functional and transparent to the user.

title: Frontend: Develop Management and Dynamic Execution UI
description: Create the management screen to list/launch modes. Develop the dynamic form renderer component that takes a mode's JSON definition and renders the UI. Wire this up to the execution API.
sprint_goal: Complete the custom mode user flow, conduct final QA for offline and custom modes, and perform the major accessibility remediation across the entire app.
acceptance_criteria: Management screen lists modes. Execution view dynamically renders inputs/outputs. Calculation calls API and displays results.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; E2E tests for the full custom mode lifecycle passing.
testing_requirements: E2E tests for creating, launching, and executing a custom mode.
deployment_notes: The primary user-facing component of the custom mode feature.
business_value: Allows users to interact with and gain value from their custom-built calculators.

title: QA: Performance and Security Testing for Custom Modes
description: Conduct targeted performance tests on the execution endpoint to validate the P95 < 500ms requirement. Perform exploratory security testing to attempt to bypass sandbox restrictions.
sprint_goal: Complete the custom mode user flow, conduct final QA for offline and custom modes, and perform the major accessibility remediation across the entire app.
acceptance_criteria: Load test report confirms API meets NFR. Security report confirms no vulnerabilities found.
definition_of_done: Test reports reviewed and approved.
testing_requirements: Performance and security testing.
deployment_notes: Final quality gate for the custom mode feature.
business_value: Ensures the custom mode feature is performant and secure before release.

title: QA: Full E2E Test Suite for Offline Scenarios
description: Design and implement a comprehensive suite of Cypress E2E tests that programmatically control network connectivity to validate all offline functionality and synchronization logic.
sprint_goal: Complete the custom mode user flow, conduct final QA for offline and custom modes, and perform the major accessibility remediation across the entire app.
acceptance_criteria: Test cases for creating data offline, conflict resolution, sync failure/retry, and session closure mid-sync are implemented.
definition_of_done: All offline E2E tests pass reliably in the CI pipeline.
testing_requirements: E2E testing with network manipulation.
deployment_notes: Final quality assurance for the most complex non-functional requirement.
business_value: Guarantees data integrity and a reliable user experience for the offline feature.

title: Audit and Remediate Core Components for Accessibility
description: Perform a comprehensive audit of all core UI components against WCAG 2.1 AA. Remediate issues related to keyboard navigation, focus management, semantic HTML, and ARIA attributes.
sprint_goal: Complete the custom mode user flow, conduct final QA for offline and custom modes, and perform the major accessibility remediation across the entire app.
acceptance_criteria: All interactive elements are keyboard operable. Modals trap focus. Dynamic updates are announced. All form inputs have labels.
definition_of_done: Passing automated Axe scans and successful manual testing with NVDA/VoiceOver.
testing_requirements: Manual screen reader and keyboard testing.
deployment_notes: Large, cross-cutting effort to achieve compliance.
business_value: Ensures the application is usable by people with disabilities and meets legal requirements.

title: Create Accessibility Testing Documentation
description: Create a formal accessibility testing checklist and a runbook for manual testing procedures to guide developers and QA in maintaining compliance for all future features.
sprint_goal: Complete the custom mode user flow, conduct final QA for offline and custom modes, and perform the major accessibility remediation across the entire app.
acceptance_criteria: A checklist covering key WCAG 2.1 AA criteria is created. A document outlines the process for manual testing. Documentation is in the project repo.
definition_of_done: Documentation is peer-reviewed and approved.
testing_requirements: Peer review.
deployment_notes: Establishes long-term quality process.
business_value: Helps maintain accessibility compliance over the project's lifecycle.
